comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: Thank you, LOC, for uploading these wonderful photos of the suffragettes...I am a male, but I have always been for women's rights, and I cannot believe that in this country, women were NOT allowed to vote for many, many years.  I am sorry, but it just shows that men thought they were somehow better than women because they were stronger physically.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
A Bain/LOC photo of the suffragist leader, "General" Rosalie Jones, leading the holidays' march from NYC to Albany, New York:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4690770664/in/photostream/]

Other Bain/LOC photos from the NYC-Albany suffragists' march:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4690770530/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4690135527/in/photostream/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4690140397/in/photostream/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4690135055/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4690135249/]

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Anyone know who the unusually tall woman is in these photos, to the left in most of the shots?

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: She may be Eva Ward, who was a visiting suffragist from England.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Aha, that's exactly who it is--thank you!  To confirm, I googled her name with "suffrage" and found a photo of her accompanying an article.  The article mentions that she is "probably over six feet in height and... looks the part of a militant more than Mrs. Pankhurst ever did."
